data.text: Contents
Introduction

Vinca Alkaloids including, but not exclusively, Vincristine, Vinblastine, Vindesine and Vinorelbine, are anticancer drugs which, if given intrathecally (into the spine), will result in death or severe paralysis.

This policy applies to the labelling and dilution of Vinca Alkaloids (including vincristine, vinblastine, vindesine and vinorelbine). If other intravenous Vinca Alkaloids become available, they will be deemed to be covered by the policy.
The National Patient Safety Agency Rapid Response Report 2008 RRR004 made recommendations to reduce the incidence of death caused by the mal- administration of Vinca Alkaloids.
This policy outlines the recommendations and provides guidance for the safe supply and administration of Vinca Alkaloids in respect of cancer services.

It applies, primarily to the treatment of adults but includes provision for the treatment of children. The policy should be followed alongside Trust guidelines for the Administration of Cytotoxic Drugs (or equivalent).
Scope
The purpose of this document is to:
The purpose of this document is to ensure the safe supply, labelling and dilution of Vinca Alkaloids in the Trust.
Definitions

table_items.text: National guidance provided in Health Service Circular HSC 2008/001 updated national guidance on the safe administration of Intrathecal chemotherapy (August 2008)
Mid & South Essex NHS Foundation Trust
The following drugs are included in this definition: vincristine, vinblastine, vindesine and vinorelbine.

data.text: Role & Responsibilities within the Trust
MSE Patient Safety & Quality Group
Receiving exception reports and taking action in response to issues raised from Medicines Assurance Group and/or department of pharmacy.
MSE Medicines Assurance Group
Ensuring the effective implementation, use and timely review of this policy;
Ensuring that monitoring arrangements are appropriately performed by the Site Medicines Optimisation and Safety Groups (MOSG);

Where necessary, escalating concerns to the Chief Nursing Officer, site Director of Nursing, Deputy Director of Nursing for Cancer or Chief Medical Officer, site Medical Director, Medical Director for Cancer as appropriate;
Exception reporting to the MSE Patient Safety & Quality Group on developments,
concerns and progress concerning vinca alkaloid use.
Site Medicines Optimisation and Safety Group (MOSG)
Monitoring this policy through incident reports;
Escalating issues to divisional governance groups and MAG as appropriate.
MSE SACT Quality Group
On-going review and implementation of processes outlined within this document;
Ensuring that follow-up and investigation of vinca alkaloid incidents is completed in accordance with Trust policies for incident management (MSEPO-19014 & 19015, and medication errors MSEPO-20206;
Facilitating feedback with any actions taken and recommendations for changes in practice;
Reviewing this policy annually to ensure it remains up to date and relevant.
MSE Pharmacy Governance Group & Oncology Division Governance Group
Taking action with respect to divisional service delivery.
Chief Executive

As the Trust's accountable officer has overall responsibility for ensuring the Trust has robust, complete and up to date documents in place to govern and guide activities so that legal, and national requirements are met.
Has the overall responsibility for compliance with guidance in HSC 2008/001.
Chief Medical Officer
Ensuring that there is policy compliance and liaising with the Site Medical Directors that the service is operating effectively;
Ensuring sufficient resources are in place to implement this policy
Ensuring any escalated vinca alkaloid issues involving professions they oversee are appropriately managed corporately.
Site Medical Directors
Ensuring that there is policy compliance on site by all professions they oversee and that the service is operating effectively;
Ensuring any escalated vinca alkaloid issues involving professions they oversee are appropriately managed corporately.
Cancer Division Medical Director
Ensuring prescribers are implementing and monitoring vinca alkaloid management in their areas;
Ensuring areas under their responsibility are appropriately monitored and supported following audit to ensure sustained improvement is achieved;
Chief Nursing Officer
Ensuring that there is policy compliance and liaising with the Deputy / Chief Pharmacist that the service is operating effectively;
Ensuring sufficient resources are in place to implement this policy;
Ensuring any escalated vinca alkaloid issues involving professions they oversee are appropriately managed corporately.
Ensuring that safe systems and practices are implemented and maintained within wards, departments and/or teams.
Ensuring there are systems in place to provide relevant education and training for
nursing staff.
Site Director of Nursing / Deputy Director of Nursing for Cancer
Ensuring that there is policy compliance on site by all professions they oversee and that the service is operating effectively;
Ensuring any escalated vinca alkaloid issues involving professions they oversee are appropriately managed corporately;
Ensuring sufficient resources are in place to implement this policy;
Chief Pharmacist
Is accountable to the chief executive for ensuring compliance with this policy and that relevant pharmacy staff are aware of its contents.
Setting the overall framework and policy standards for vinca alkaloids across the organisation, in line with regulatory and best practice guidance;
Ensuring a monitoring process exists and functions for policy standard.
The Chief Pharmacist delegates this responsibility to the Deputy Chief Pharmacist and site clinical lead pharmacists for delivery.
Site Lead Pharmacist for Oncology and Haematology
Ensuring that prescriptions and dose requests comply with Guidance in HSC 2008/001.
MSE Head of Pharmacy Technical Services
Ensuring that vinca alkaloids are labelled and diluted in accordance with this policy during the dose manufacturing process(s).
All prescribers involved in the prescribing of Vinca Alkaloids
Ensuring that they always comply with the requirements of the policy and ensure all prescriptions / written orders are written in accordance with the law.
All pharmacy technical services staff
Preparing vinca alkaloids in accordance with this policy and the pharmacy departmental standard operating procedures.
Prescriptions for Vinca Alkaloids

Prescriptions for Vinca Alkaloids must be checked by suitably trained pharmacist(s) in accordance with existing pharmacy procedures to ensure the route is clearly identified as intravenous and the appropriate volume and administration time is specified.
Labelling of Vinca Alkaloids
Vinca Alkaloids will be labelled with the patient name, hospital identifier, name of product, route of administration and a warning as follows: “For intravenous use only
– fatal if administered by other routes.”
Negative labelling e.g. “Not for ……use” MUST NEVER be used.
Dilution of Vinca Alkaloids
Adult patients
For adult patients, the dose of Vinca Alkaloid will be supplied in a ready to administer 50ml minibag of sodium chloride 0.9%.
Adolescent patients

The Trust does not currently have an adolescent unit. If adolescent patients are treated on the adult unit then doses of vinca alkaloids will be provided as for adults i.e. in a ready to administer 50ml minibag of sodium chloride 0.9%.
If adolescent patients are treated on the paediatric unit then doses of vinca alkaloids will be provided in a pre-filled syringe diluted with 20ml Sodium Chloride 0.9%.
Paediatric patients
Currently limited to POSCU service providing Vincristine only.
For paediatric patients, the dose of Vinca Alkaloid will always be supplied in a pre-filled syringe diluted with 20ml with Sodium Chloride 0.9%.
Training
Staff being trained in the prescribing, dispensing, administration and checking of intravenous chemotherapy will be made aware of this policy and the need for compliance with it.
Monitoring and Audit
Outlined below is the Trust's process of monitoring compliance with, and the effectiveness of the document's main points.

data.text: Approval and Implementation

All policies, procedures and guidelines will be approved by Medicines Assurance Group, which is the specialist group with the authority to approve local medication documents. These will then be forwarded to the Document control team for submission and ratification by the Joint Document Management Group.
It is the author's responsibility to inform all prescribers, nursing and pharmacy of the approved policy documents when they are uploaded to the Trust's Intranets.
Equality Impact Assessment
The Trust is committed to the provision of a service that is fair, accessible and meets the needs of all individuals.
(Refer to appendix 1)
References

National Patients Safety Agency. 2008. Rapid Response Report: Using Vinca Alkaloid Minibags (Adult/Adolescent Units), NPSA/2008/RRR004.
